lead_paragraph: Four Afghan policemen and two soldiers were killed in the attack in Helmand Province, and eight others were wounded.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan, David Jolly and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul and Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan.

headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack Army Post Using Stolen Vehicles
headline.main: Taliban, Using Humvees Stolen From Army, Attack Check Post

snippet: Four Afghan policemen and two soldiers were killed in the attack in Helmand Province, and eight others were wounded.
abstract: Taliban suicide bombers in two stolen Afghan Army Humvees kill six security personnel at checkpoint in Helmand Province; attack confirms Afghan government's fears that insurgents could gain advantage by turning stolen military equipment against government forces.
